meanings.definition: The state or quality of being permanent.
meanings.sent1: The permanency of the stone wall ensured its durability.
meanings.sent2: We sought a sense of permanency in our new home.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a permanent marker losing its permanency is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a permanency that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The permanency of the mountain range was awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: The permanence of an object or situation.
meanings.sent1: The permanency of the painting made it a valuable heirloom.
meanings.sent2: The permanency of the rules ensured order in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch its tail showed a lack of understanding of permanency.
meanings.sent4: His love for her had a permanency that never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The permanency of the diamond symbolized their eternal bond.
